thread.title: Penn. newborn's death ruled a homicide after parents overdosed
thread.title_full: Penn. newborn's death ruled a homicide after parents overdosed

author: ELIZABETH ELIZALDE
title: Penn. newborn's death ruled a homicide after parents overdosed
text:
Pennsylvania newborn's death ruled a homicide after parents overdosed on fentanyl Penn. newborn's death ruled a homicide after parents overdosed  41 PM 
The death of a Pennsylvania newborn who starved inside a home and died days after her parents overdosed on fentanyl has been ruled a homicide. 
Summer Chambers’ autopsy revealed she died of dehydration and starvation at her home in Johnstown on Dec. 20, about four or five days after her parents died, Cambria County Coroner Jeff Lees said. 
"It's unfathomable to think what this child endured while it was alive," Johnstown police Chief Jeff Janciga said, WJAC-TV reported. Summer Chambers died of starvation a week after her parents died of a drug overdose. (Facebook) 
The 5-month-old’s parents, 27-year-old Jason Chambers and 19-year-old Chelsea Cardaro, were found dead at the home on Dec. 22 after consuming acute fentanyl overdoses, their toxicology reports showed. 
Killer Brooklyn mom haunted by thoughts of slain 4-year-old 
The family was from New York and had been living in the house since May, according to a neighbor. Jason Chambers, 27, and Chelsea Cardaro, 19 both overdosed on fentanyl, leaving their 5-month-old daughter to starve to death. (Facebook) 
Lees ruled their deaths accidental, and heroin was also recovered from the home that same day. 
District attorney officials and police detectives are investigating the child's death since the parents can't be criminally charged, Janciga said. Summer Chambers’ death has been ruled a homicide. (Facebook) Pennsylvania residents Jason Chambers, 27, and Chelsea Cardaro, 19 both overdosed on fentanyl, leaving their 5 month old daughter trapped inside of the house to eventually die as well of dehydration and starvation. (Facebook) 
The family was from New York and had lived in the home since May, a neighbor said.
